articles.title: whoami
articles.contents:
Contact
Twitter
Website
GitHub
LinkedIn
Education
M.S. in Analytics, May 2020 | Georgia Institute of Technology
B.S. in Electrical Engineering, May 2016 | The University of Texas
at Austin
Interests
sports analytics, e-sports
data science, open-source development
Other
Contestant on seasons 0 and 1 of “Sliced”,
a Twitch show like the TV show “Chopped”, but for data science
RWeekly newsletter curator

articles.title: Projects
articles.contents:
Packages
I co-maintain {worldfootballR},
an R package for extracting world football (soccer) data from several
sites. I work mostly with the Fotmob functions.
I wrote {valorantr},
an R package for pro Valorant data from rib.gg.
I contributed functions for scraping data from ESPN to {ffscrapr},
an R API client for several fantasy football league platforms.
Projects
2022
Carnegie Melon Sports Analytics Conference (CMSAC) paper: “The
Hot Hand Fallacy in Call of Duty Search and Destroy”
“Bundesliga
tax” analysis cited in The
Athletic, Tifo
Football, ESPN,
Grace
Robertson, and more.
2021
Big Data Bowl (Big Data Bowl) team submission (finalist) | “Weighted
Assessment of Defender Affectiveness (WADE)”: A framework for
quantifying NFL defensive back coverage and contest skills.
2021
BDB individual submission | “Assessing
Pick Plays and How They’re Defended”: Quantifying the causal impact
of pick routes run by NFL receivers using tracking data.
Sports analytics
visualization gallery: A collection of visualizations (mostly
soccer) that I’ve tweeted out.
{xengagement}
(author): An R package, Twitter bot, and python Dash app for predicting,
visualizing, and summarizing the amount of Twitter engagement that xGPhilosophy receives with
its end-of-match xG summary tweets.
NBA win
probability: Code for calculating NBA win probability and discussion
(1-day sprint project).
NBA Regularized
Adjusted Plus Minus (RAPM): Code for calculating RAPM given cleaned
NBA play-by-play data.
